About.title: About
About.intro: Hey there! I'm Zsolt VarjÃº, a passionate web enthusiast from ÄŒierna Voda, Slovakia. I started my journey as a Web Page Tester, working closely with frontend developers, which sparked my love for frontend development. Armed with a master's degree from Constantine the Philosopher University in Nitra, I am now diving into the world of React, Next.js and headless CMSs, ready to bring design files to life with seamless functionality and exceptional user experiences.
About.currentWork: Currently, I work as a web tester, but I am transitioning into a frontend developer role. Outside of web development, you'll often find me running, skiing, or exploring 3D printing and tinkering with microPCs like Arduino. I also enjoy 3D modeling whenever I get the chance.
About.jobSearch: I'm on the lookout for a frontend developer position where I can merge my skills and passion for creating stunning web designs.
About.quote: As {author} wisely said, "Luck is when preparation meets opportunity" and I feel prepared, just waiting for the right opportunity to come along.
About.connect: If you think we might be a good fit, let's connect! ðŸ”—

Contact.title: Contact
Contact.message: Shoot me an email if you want to connect! You can also find me on

responsibilities.title: Functionality Testing:
responsibilities.description: Conducting thorough manual testing of web pages to verify that all features operate correctly across various browsers and devices. Identifying and reporting discrepancies or bugs promptly.

responsibilities.title: Visual Consistency:
responsibilities.description: Assessing the visual appearance of web pages to ensure they match the provided graphic design specifications. Communicating deviations to the relevant team members and providing detailed feedback for necessary corrections.

responsibilities.title: Quality Assurance:
responsibilities.description: Maintaining high standards of quality by rigorously testing web pages, ensuring they meet required specifications and user expectations.

responsibilities.title: Communication:
responsibilities.description: Collaborating effectively with designers, developers, and project managers to address issues found during testing and offering suggestions for improvements and clarifications.

responsibilities.title: Remote Work:
responsibilities.description: Managing all tasks independently while adhering to strict deadlines and utilizing effective time management skills to complete tasks efficiently and accurately.

responsibilities.title: Documentation:
responsibilities.description: Maintaining detailed records of test results, issues identified, and corrective actions taken, and providing comprehensive reports to relevant stakeholders.

hero.title: I'm a
hero.description: I recently completed my Master's degree in Applied Informatics and am now a web developer with expertise in Headless CMS and Next.js. I'm also highly adaptable and eager to work with a variety of technologies. Let's connect!

infoMapSK.title: InfoMapSK - Interactive Demographic Data Visualization
infoMapSK.description: A full-stack web application for visualizing demographic data of Slovakia, featuring an interactive map and various data categories. Developed as a master's thesis project.

modalContent.para1: InfoMapSK is a comprehensive full-stack web application developed as part of a master's thesis project. It provides an interactive platform for exploring and visualizing demographic data across different administrative levels of Slovakia.
modalContent.featuresList: Interactive map of Slovakia with region, district, and city/village selection | Visualization of demographic data using various chart types | Multiple data categories: Population, Economic Activity, Agriculture, and Organizational Statistics | Search functionality for specific locations | Responsive design optimized for various devices | Accessibility features following WCAG 2.1 guidelines | Contact form for user feedback and inquiries
modalContent.para2: This project showcases proficiency in full-stack development using the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React, Node.js). The frontend is built with React and styled with TailwindCSS, while the backend utilizes Node.js with Express.js and MongoDB for data caching.
modalContent.technologiesList: The development process involved integrating various technologies and APIs, including:
modalContent.techList: React-leaflet for interactive mapping | Recharts for data visualization | Formik and Yup for form handling and validation | Statistical Office of the Slovak Republic API for demographic data | Geoportal of Slovakia for geospatial information
modalContent.para3: This project demonstrates the ability to create a complex, data-driven web application while adhering to best practices in responsive design, accessibility, and modern web development techniques. It showcases skills in both frontend and backend development, as well as data visualization and integration with external APIs.

gardenBros.title: Garden Bros Website Frontend
gardenBros.description: A multilingual website for a gardening company, built with Next.js, styled with Tailwind CSS, and managed through Strapi CMS. Features responsive design, dynamic content generation, and deployment on Vercel.

modalContent.para1: The Garden Bros Website Frontend is a multilingual platform for a gardening company to promote their services and showcase their work. Built with Next.js, styled using Tailwind CSS, and managed through Strapi CMS, it offers a responsive and dynamic user experience.
modalContent.featuresList: Responsive main page with dynamic components | Fully-featured contact page and FAQ section | Blog with author-written posts | Multilingual support (Slovak, Hungarian, English) | Dynamic page generation | Content management through Strapi CMS
modalContent.para2: The project showcases my ability to create a full-featured, multilingual website using modern web technologies. It demonstrates skills in frontend development, responsive design with Tailwind CSS, CMS integration, and deployment strategies.
modalContent.para3: Tailwind CSS was used to create a custom, responsive design that perfectly fits the client's needs. This utility-first CSS framework allowed for rapid development of a unique and visually appealing interface while maintaining consistency across the site.
modalContent.para4: The website is deployed on Vercel, ensuring fast loading times and reliable performance. The use of Strapi CMS allows for easy content management and updates without requiring changes to the codebase.
modalContent.para5: This project highlights my proficiency in creating scalable, maintainable, and user-friendly web applications that cater to specific business needs while providing an excellent user experience and visually striking design.

portfolio.title: My First Portfolio
portfolio.description: My initial web development portfolio showcasing early projects and skills, built with plain HTML, CSS, and JavaScript with GSAP for animations.

modalContent.para1: This portfolio is my first attempt at showcasing my web development skills and projects. It represents the beginning of my journey in web development and displays the various components and small projects I built while learning.
modalContent.featuresList: Responsive design for various screen sizes | Animated elements using GSAP (GreenSock Animation Platform) | Showcase of beginner-level projects and components | Clean and simple user interface
modalContent.para2: This project demonstrates my foundational skills in front-end web development. It was built using semantic HTML5 markup, styled with CSS3, and enhanced with JavaScript for interactivity. GSAP was used to implement smooth animations, adding a dynamic feel to the portfolio.
modalContent.para3: The development process involved applying fundamental web development concepts and exploring animation techniques with GSAP. This portfolio served as a practical exercise in creating a responsive layout and organizing a showcase of multiple projects.
modalContent.para4: While this represents my early work, it laid the foundation for my growth as a web developer. Future improvements planned include adding more complex projects, enhancing the design, implementing advanced JavaScript functionality, and potentially integrating a backend for dynamic content.

scoot.title: Scoot Sharing Web App
scoot.description: A responsive web app for a fictional scooter rental service, featuring multiple pages and a contact form. Built with Next.js and deployed on Vercel.

modalContent.para1: The Scoot Sharing Web App is a responsive web application that showcases a fictional scooter rental service. This project demonstrates proficiency in modern web development technologies and responsive design principles.
modalContent.featuresList: Responsive design with a mobile-first approach | Five fully functional pages: Landing, About, FAQ, Locations, and Contact | Static map image on the Locations page | Fully functional contact form | Optimized for all screen resolutions
modalContent.para2: This project showcases my proficiency in Next.js and modern web development practices. It was built using Next.js, styled with Tailwind CSS, and enhanced with React for interactivity.
modalContent.para3: The development process involved implementing a multi-page application structure, creating responsive layouts, and integrating a functional contact form. I also focused on optimizing the site for various screen sizes and ensuring a consistent user experience across devices.
modalContent.para4: This project demonstrates my ability to create comprehensive, multi-page web applications while adhering to best practices in responsive design and modern web development techniques.

alza.title: Alza Dni KupÃ³novÃ½ Filter
alza.description: A Chrome extension that helps users filter products during Alza Days sales by various coupon codes, making it easier to find the best discounts on Alza.sk.

modalContent.para1: Alza Dni KupÃ³novÃ½ Filter is a useful tool for anyone shopping during Alza Days. This Chrome extension allows you to easily filter products by various coupon codes, helping you quickly find the best discounts on Alza.sk.
modalContent.featuresList: Filtering products by coupon codes (5%, 10%, 15%, 20%, 25%, 30%, 50%) | Option to filter only currently displayed products or load all products | Simple and clear user interface | Quick filter removal with one click
modalContent.para2: The extension demonstrates my ability to create practical tools that enhance user experience on e-commerce platforms. It showcases skills in JavaScript, Chrome Extension API, and frontend development.
modalContent.para3: The project uses vanilla JavaScript to interact with the webpage DOM, filter products, and manage the extension's UI. The Chrome Extension API is utilized to create a browser action and handle background scripts.
modalContent.para4: This extension highlights my proficiency in creating solutions that address specific user needs, improving the shopping experience during promotional events. It also demonstrates my ability to work with browser APIs and create user-friendly interfaces for browser extensions.
modalContent.para5: The project is open-source, inviting contributions from the developer community, which shows my commitment to collaborative development and continuous improvement of software projects.

github.title: GitHub User Search App
github.description: A responsive web app that allows users to search for GitHub profiles, view user information, and switch between light and dark themes. Built as a solution to a Frontend Mentor challenge.

modalContent.para1: The GitHub User Search App is a responsive web application that enables users to search for GitHub profiles and view relevant user information. This project was developed as a solution to a Frontend Mentor challenge, demonstrating skills in frontend development and API integration.
modalContent.featuresList: Responsive layout optimized for various screen sizes | GitHub user search functionality using the GitHub API | Display of relevant user information based on the search | Light and dark theme switching | Automatic theme selection based on user's system preferences | Interactive elements with hover states
modalContent.para2: This project showcases my proficiency in modern web development technologies and practices. It was built using semantic HTML5 markup, styled with Tailwind CSS, and enhanced with JavaScript for interactivity. The GitHub API integration was handled using Axios, and animations were implemented with GSAP.
modalContent.para3: The development process involved learning and applying new concepts such as working with APIs, implementing dark/light themes, and using Tailwind CSS for the first time. I also incorporated error handling for API requests and used JavaScript modules to organize the codebase.
modalContent.para4: This project demonstrates my ability to create functional, visually appealing web applications while adhering to modern development practices and continuously learning new technologies.
